intro: Illicium wardii, commonly known as the "Mexican star anise," is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Schisandraceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped flowers and distinctive, aromatic fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a smooth or slightly serrated margin. The fruit, which resembles a star anise, contains aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine and culinary applications.
